metadata.title: Interactive web-based graphs of novel coronavirus COVID-19 cases and deaths per population by country

affiliation.institution: Sapporo Medical University School of Medicine

abstract.text: An accurate grasp of COVID-19 situation is considered highly important. The website we launched provides graphs of COVID-19 cases and deaths per one million population over time including trajectory analysis, and one can easily grasp the COVID-19 trend and adequately compare the situation between countries through this interactive graph system.

body_text.text: A c c e p t e d M a n u s c r i p t Infection with the novel coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 has become a pandemic and has caused many deaths worldwide. Therefore, an accurate grasp of the SARS-CoV-2 [2, 3] , World Health Organization (WHO) situation reports [4] , and population data of the United Nations [5] are presented, and one can easily grasp the trend of COVID-19 and adequately compare the situation between countries through this interactive graph system. Furthermore, the graphs of trajectory analysis are also available.

As an example easily obtained in the website, the transition of COVID-19 cases and deaths over time in several G20 countries are presented in Fig. The chart indicates that countries except for Japan have nearly the same increase ratio (i.e., the slopes of the graph are parallel on a logarithmic scale), while the increase ratio is obviously lower in Japan than in other countries for both cases and deaths. The reason for the difference is currently unclear and the situation continues to be unpredictable.
This website is provided not only for researchers but also for anybody interested in the A c c e p t e d M a n u s c r i p t

BIBREF0.title: An interactive web-based dashboard to track COVID-19 in real time

BIBREF1.title: European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC)

TABREF0.text: infectious disease (COVID-19) situation is considered highly important. Several websites provide useful information about COVID-19, such as the Coronavirus Transition of New Coronavirus COVID-19 Cases and Deaths per Population by Country (https://web.sapmed.ac.jp/canmol/coronavirus/index_e.html), on March 23, 2020.
